Mexican Street Corn Dip

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the vibrant world of Mexican cuisine with our delightful Mexican Street Corn Dip recipe! This creamy and flavorful dip combines the irresistible taste of roasted corn with the tangy zest of lime and the rich creaminess of cheeses, making it a perfect appetizer for any gathering. Whether you're hosting a summer barbecue, a game day party, or simply craving a tasty snack, this dip is sure to impress your guests and leave them coming back for more. With its easy-to-follow steps and simple ingredients, you can whip up this crowd-pleaser in no time. Let’s dive into the recipe and discover how to create a dip that captures the essence of beloved Mexican street food right in your kitchen!

Ingredients

corn (frozen or canned)

If using frozen corn, sauté it in a skillet with a bit of olive oil or butter for added flavor and to enhance the sweetness. For canned corn, opt for low-sodium varieties to control salt levels. You can also substitute with fresh corn when in season; just cut the kernels off the cob and blanch them briefly before adding.

cream cheese

Let the cream cheese soften at room temperature for easier mixing. If you're looking for a lighter option, you can substitute with Greek yogurt or a lower-fat cream cheese. For a tangier flavor, try using herbed cream cheese.

sour cream

Choose full-fat sour cream for a richer flavor, but you can substitute with Greek yogurt for a healthier twist. For added flavor, consider using a flavored sour cream, such as chipotle, or mix in some lime zest.

mayonnaise

Use a high-quality mayonnaise for the best flavor. If you're avoiding mayonnaise, you can substitute with avocado or a vegan mayo for a healthier option. Adding a dash of mustard can enhance the dip's tanginess.

cotija cheese

Cotija provides a salty, crumbly texture. If unavailable, feta cheese makes a great substitute, though it's saltier. For a milder flavor, you can also use ricotta or goat cheese.

lime juice

Fresh lime juice is ideal for the best flavor; bottled lime juice can be used in a pinch but may lack the freshness. For a twist, try adding some lime zest to enhance the citrus flavor.

chili powder

Adjust the amount of chili powder based on your spice tolerance. You can substitute with smoked paprika for a smoky flavor or use a blend of cumin and cayenne for a different spice profile.

garlic powder

For a fresher taste, consider using minced garlic instead, but use less (1/2 to 1 clove) as it's stronger. If you prefer a milder flavor, reduce the garlic powder amount.

cilantro (chopped)

Fresh cilantro adds brightness; however, if you're not a fan, fresh parsley can be used as a substitute. To enhance the flavor, consider adding a pinch of cilantro stems, which are more flavorful.

salt

Use salt to taste, but be cautious if you're using salty ingredients like Cotija cheese. Instead of table salt, consider using kosher salt for better flavor distribution.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper provides the best flavor. You can also experiment with white pepper or even a pinch of cayenne for added heat.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Corn

    If using frozen corn, add 2 cups to a skillet over medium heat. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through. If using canned corn, simply drain and rinse it under cold water to remove excess sodium.

  • Step 2: Mix the Base

    In a large mixing bowl, combine 8 oz cream cheese, 1/2 cup sour cream, and 1/4 cup mayonnaise. Use a hand mixer or a whisk to blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy. This is crucial for ensuring that the dip has a velvety texture.

  • Step 3: Incorporate the Corn and Seasonings

    To the creamy mixture, add the cooked corn, 1/2 cup Cotija cheese, 2 tbsp lime juice, 1 tsp chili powder, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 cup chopped cilantro, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir gently but thoroughly until everything is evenly combined.

  • Step 4: Transfer to Baking Dish

    Scoop the corn mixture into a baking dish, spreading it out evenly. This ensures that it heats through uniformly and that every scoop has the same great flavor.

  • Step 5: Bake the Dip

    Place the baking dish in a preheated oven set to 350°F (175°C). Bake for about 10-15 minutes, or until the dip is bubbly and the top is slightly golden. Keep an eye on it to prevent over-baking.

  • Step 6: Serve and Enjoy

    Once out of the oven, let the dip cool for a few minutes. Serve warm with tortilla chips or fresh veggies like bell pepper strips or cucumber slices for dipping.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare corn for this dip?

If using frozen corn, simply cook it in a skillet over medium heat for about 5-7 minutes until heated through. For canned corn, make sure to drain and rinse it before adding it to the mix. This will help remove excess salt and keep the dip fresh.

What should I do if my cream cheese is too hard to mix?

Let your cream cheese sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before you start. If you're in a hurry, you can microwave it for about 10-15 seconds to soften it slightly. Just be careful not to melt it!

Can I use a substitute for Cotija cheese?

Yes! If you can't find Cotija cheese, you can substitute it with feta cheese or queso fresco, both of which have similar flavors and textures.

How can I adjust the spice level of the dip?

To make the dip milder, you can reduce the amount of chili powder or omit it altogether. If you like it spicier, consider adding a pinch of cayenne pepper or some diced jalapeños.

What if I don't have fresh cilantro?

If fresh cilantro is unavailable, you can use dried cilantro or parsley as a substitute. Just keep in mind that dried herbs are more concentrated, so use about one-third of the amount.

How can I tell when the dip is done baking?

The dip is ready when it is bubbly and the top has a slightly golden color, usually after about 10-15 minutes in a 350°F (175°C) oven.

What can I serve with this dip?

Tortilla chips are a classic choice for serving with this dip, but you can also use fresh veggies like carrot sticks, cucumber slices, or bell pepper strips for a healthier option.

Can I make this dip ahead of time?

Absolutely! You can prepare the mixture a day in advance and store it in the refrigerator. Just remember to bake it right before serving for the best texture and flavor.

How do I safely handle and cook with hot ingredients?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot dishes, and be cautious when stirring hot mixtures to avoid splashes. Let dishes cool slightly before touching them.

What is the best way to store leftovers?

Store any leftover dip in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave before serving again.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a lighter version, consider using Greek yogurt instead of sour cream and mayonnaise. To make it gluten-free, ensure that your tortilla chips are certified gluten-free. For a vegan option, replace cream cheese with a plant-based cream cheese alternative, use vegan sour cream, and omit the Cotija cheese or substitute it with a vegan cheese option. Additionally, check that any packaged ingredients like tortilla chips are free from animal products.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing with the Mexican Street Corn Dip, consider serving it alongside crispy tortilla chips, fresh vegetable sticks (like carrots and bell peppers), or toasted pita chips. You might also enhance the experience with grilled chicken or shrimp skewers seasoned with lime and chili. For beverages, classic options include margaritas, Mexican lagers, or a chilled white sangria with citrus notes. If you prefer non-alcoholic options, try refreshing aguas frescas or a lime-infused sparkling water.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Mexican Street Corn Dip warm, straight from the oven, in a colorful ceramic baking dish for an inviting presentation. Garnish with additional chopped cilantro and a sprinkle of chili powder or extra Cotija cheese to add visual appeal. Provide a variety of dipping options, such as blue corn tortilla chips, sliced radishes, and cucumber sticks, to cater to different tastes. For a festive touch, arrange the chips in a decorative bowl and serve with lime wedges on the side for an extra burst of flavor.

Mexican Street Corn Dip

25 min
$10
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

AppetizerSnack

Tags:

DipAppetizerParty Food

Description

Creamy, zesty dip inspired by street corn, packed with flavor and perfect for sharing!

Ingredients

  • corn (frozen or canned): 2 cups
  • cream cheese: 8 oz
  • sour cream: 1/2 cup
  • mayonnaise: 1/4 cup
  • cotija cheese: 1/2 cup
  • lime juice: 2 tbsp
  • chili powder: 1 tsp
  • garlic powder: 1/2 tsp
  • cilantro (chopped): 1/4 cup
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
